intro: Psychotria trachystyla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of rainforests. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological research.
